headline: Waste Management beats quarterly estimates on higher pricing
summary: Waste Management beat second-quarter profit and revenue estimates on Monday, aided by higher pricing and steady demand for garbage collection and disposal. WM, which collects and transfers trash to company landfills and recycles it into energy, has benefited from the use of automation, cutting labor costs and boosting efficiency. Alongside municipal waste departments, WM and Republic Services are two major companies that lead garbage collection across significant regions of the United States.

raw.headline: Waste Management beats quarterly estimates on higher pricing

WM, which collects and transfers trash to company landfills and recycles it into energy, has benefited from the use of automation, cutting labor costs and boosting efficiency. Alongside municipal waste departments, WM and Republic Services are two major companies that lead garbage collection across significant regions of the United States.

headline: Waste Management (NYSE:WM) Beats Q2 Sales Targets
summary: Waste management services provider Waste Management (NYSE:WM) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 19% year on year to $6.43 billion. On the other hand, the company’s full-year revenue guidance of $25.38 billion at the midpoint came in 0.5% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.92 per share was 1.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

Its non-GAAP profit of $1.92 per share was 1.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Waste Management (WM) Q2 Earnings and Revenues Beat Estimates
summary: Waste Management (WM) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +1.59% and +1.39%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Waste Management beats Q2 expectations, raises free cash flow guidance
summary: Investing.com -- Waste Management Inc (NYSE:WM) reported second-quarter earnings that exceeded analyst expectations, with adjusted earnings per share of $1.92 beating estimates by $0.02 and revenue of $6.43 billion surpassing the consensus of $6.37 billion. The company’s shares rose 1% in aftermarket trade following the announcement.

headline: Waste Management: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: HOUSTON (AP) — Waste Management Inc. WM) on Monday reported second-quarter net income of $726 million. The Houston-based company said it had profit of $1.80 per share.
